abstract: Dow Chemical‘s chief executive, Andrew Liveris, was forced to swallow a bitter pill on Thursday when the company cut its dividend for the first time since 1912. The move will save Dow about $1 billion a year and may help the company complete its proposed $15 billion takeover of Rohm & Haas.
lead_paragraph: Dow Chemical‘s chief executive, Andrew Liveris, was forced to swallow a bitter pill on Thursday when the company cut its dividend for the first time since 1912. The move will save Dow about $1 billion a year and may help the company complete its proposed $15 billion takeover of Rohm & Haas.

headline.main: Pushed to Do Rohm Deal, Dow Cuts Dividend
